title: Truly Vietnam Cuisine Taste Tour 1
destinations: Hanoi - Halong Bay - Hoi An - Hue - Ho Chi Minh City - Mekong Delta - Cu Chi Tunnels – Vietnam
highlight: We'll see that in Hanoi's lovely Old Quarter, where the city's hectic rhythm may be experienced.
Great entertainment and the ideal opportunity to sample some of the lesser-known foods that locals in Hanoi and Hoi An enjoy eating.
Take in the breathtaking natural splendor of Halong Bay, which is a World Heritage Site and is also known as 'Dragon Descending to the Sea' in Vietnamese.

itinerary.title: Day 1: Hanoi the capital of Vietnam
content: Upon arrival in the charming city of Hanoi, you will be greeted warmly by our tour guide before proceeding to your reserved hotel.
Hotels in Hanoi begin offering check-in services at 2 p.m., so you can arrive by then or pay an extra price for early check-in.
You will have the rest of the day to unwind after such a lengthy flight to Hanoi.
You can either sleep at that time to refresh your head or wander around the neighborhood around your hotel to take in the ambiance of Hanoi (highly recommended in Hanoi Autumn).

itinerary.title: Day 2: Hanoi City Tour
content: 1. Café Trứng (Egg Coffee) at Café Giảng on Yen Phu St..
2. Long Bien Bridge/ Chuong Duong Bridge
3. Nha Hat Lon (Hanoi Opera House)
4. Ho Guom (Hoàn Kiếm Lake)

itinerary.title: Day 3: Hanoi to Halong Bay - Overnight on Cruise
content: After breakfast, be picked up from your accommodation in Hanoi and driven to the World Heritage site.

When you get there, you'll be welcomed on board, sign in, and enjoy the overnight trip to Halong Bay. Admire the bay's breathtaking beauty, which is enhanced by its countless karst islands, caves, and beaches.
You will engage in activities like sightseeing, kayaking, or swimming following a break for lunch.
You'll be treated to a lavish dinner and the laid-back atmosphere of Halong Bay at night. Enjoy your meal and the rest of your night at sea.

itinerary.title: Day 4: Ha Long Bay and Hanoi Foodie Tour
content: Starting your second day in Halong with a morning Tai-chi class can help you clear your head. The ship will take you to the most breathtaking caverns in Halong for one final expPoppinstion after breakfast.
You will have free time to explore The Old Quarter and sample Vietnamese street food after your flight to Hanoi.

We'll show you how actual Hanoians actually live, work, and eat by taking you into the narrow lanes and alleys of the Old Quarter of Hanoi. This tour, which is by far the most popular of ours, is a lot of fun and a terrific opportunity to learn about some of the lesser-known foods that the locals like eating.

Our four courses will be properly rounded out by Bun Bo (Sauteed Beef Rice Vermicelli), Banh Cuon (Steamed Rice Rolls), 'Banh Mi', and distinctive Ca Phe Trung (Egg Coffee). Experiencing local food and drinks as well as local life and stories. Your travel experience will be much improved by the simple things!

itinerary.title: Day 5: Take a flight to Hue
content: Have breakfast at the hotel, then unwind until takeoff. You will be picked up by our driver and transported to the airport in time for your flight from Hanoi to Hue.
The tour guide meets you at the airport upon arrival and drives you to a hotel in City Centre where you may check in.

A cyclo driver will pick you up from your accommodation in the late afternoon. You'll get the chance to sample a variety of delectable Hue dishes and experience Hue's romanticism at night. Enjoy 'royal foods', which were previously only served to the King, while dining in regal grandeur.

itinerary.title: Day 6: Hue City tour
content: Thien Mu Pagoda is in Hue and is ready for your visit. A well-known Buddhist site, the pagoda is situated on the bank of the Perfume River. Thien Mu Pagoda is ideal for refreshing your thoughts because of its fascinating old design and great position where you may take in the tranquility of the Perfume River.
We continue our adventure after leaving the pagoda by going to the Imperial Citadel. Visit the King's Palace, Flag Tower, Main Gate, and the Museums of Royal Antiquities here.
You can learn about local vendors' daily operations and business practices while browsing kiosks and picking up some unique goods to take home before eating lunch at a nearby restaurant.

After a short break, we visit the Khai Dinh Tomb, which was constructed between 1920 and 1931 and is the smallest of the Nguyen Emperors' tombs but required the longest and most money to construct. This is the ideal fusion of Eastern and Western design.

The next stop on our journey is the most imposing Tomb of Emperor Minh Mang, which is renowned for its scenery and Oriental architecture. Minh Mang planned and began construction on this mausoleum, but King Thieu Tri finished it during the first days of 1841 and 1843. After visiting the Minh Mang Tomb, we'll go to a village where conical hats are made, where we may observe the artisans at work and talk to the residents before returning to the hotel.

itinerary.title: Day 7: Hue - Danang - Hoi An - Road transfer
content: Receive transportation to your Hoi An hotel reservation via private car, shuttle bus, or taxi. You can pause at various locations along the way for sightseeing and photo opportunities (admission fee is not included).
Hanoi has a lot to offer you because of its long history, myriad unique characteristics, and rich culture.

itinerary.title: Day 8: Hoi An like local in Tra Que Village
content: Meet your local guide in the hotel lobby and ride to a farm in Tra Que Village first thing in the morning.

You'll visit the vegetable garden and assist the farmers with several gardening tasks, like raking the ground, seeding, watering greens, collecting greens, and enriching the soil with seaweed from the nearby lake.
Work on the farm for the remainder of the morning, taking a break to prepare lunch with your hosts.
Many regional specialties are served at lunch, such as spring rolls and regional pancakes.
After enjoying a foot massage, bid your host family by and ride back to Hoi An.

You can take a journey to the craftsman's house in the late afternoon, where he will give you a quick introduction to the history, design, and color of lanterns as well as the processes involved in manufacturing them. You will have the opportunity to create your own lantern that you can keep as a keepsake.

itinerary.title: Day 9: Hoi An Foodie Tour
content: The cuisine and culture of Hoi An may be explored in the ideal way on the Evening Foodie trip. Our tour begins just before twilight and takes you to a variety of local cafes, markets, restaurants, and food stalls, providing you with a memorable and full culinary experience.
We begin visiting local locations and perusing the food stands to learn about the local specialties of Hoi An, which include:

itinerary.title: Day 1: Welcome to Hanoi, Vietnam
itinerary.content: Our tour will give you the friendliest greeting the city has to offer and transport you right to the hotel you've reserved.

itinerary.title: Day 2: Hanoi City Tour and Walking Food Tour full day
itinerary.content: Hanoi has a lot to offer you because of its long history, myriad unique characteristics, and rich culture. A city trip will provide you the chance to explore many different areas, learn about various traditions, experience new sensations, and live an eventful life.

itinerary.title: Day 3: Hanoi – Halong Bay - Overnight on Cruise
itinerary.content: You will be taken to Halong Bay, a World Heritage site, after breakfast at the hotel. Halong Bay is renowned for its tens of thousands of karst islands, amazing caves, stunning beaches, and emerald water.

Great entertainment and the ideal opportunity to sample some of the lesser-known foods that locals in Hanoi and Hoi An enjoy eating.
Take in the breathtaking natural splendor of Halong Bay, which is a World Heritage Site and is also known as 'Dragon Descending to the Sea' in Vietnamese.

itinerary.title: Day 1: Welcome to Hanoi, Vietnam
itinerary.content: Our tour will give you the friendliest greeting the city has to offer and transport you right to the hotel you've reserved.

itinerary.title: Day 2: Hanoi City Tour and Walking Food Tour full day
itinerary.content: Hanoi has a lot to offer you because of its long history, myriad unique characteristics, and rich culture. A city trip will provide you the chance to explore many different areas, learn about various traditions, experience new sensations, and live an eventful life.

itinerary.title: Day 3: Hanoi – Halong Bay - Overnight on Cruise
itinerary.content: You will be taken to Halong Bay, a World Heritage site, after breakfast at the hotel. Halong Bay is renowned for its tens of thousands of karst islands, amazing caves, stunning beaches, and emerald water.

title: Truly Vietnam Cuisine Taste Tour 22
destinations: Hanoi - Halong Bay - Hoi An - Hue - Ho Chi Minh City - Mekong Delta - Cu Chi Tunnels – Vietnam
highlight: We'll see that in Hanoi's lovely Old Quarter, where the city's hectic rhythm may be experienced.
Great entertainment and the ideal opportunity to sample some of the lesser-known foods that locals in Hanoi and Hoi An enjoy eating.
Take in the breathtaking natural splendor of Halong Bay, which is a World Heritage Site and is also known as 'Dragon Descending to the Sea' in Vietnamese.

itinerary.title: Day 1: Hanoi the capital of Vietnam
content: Upon arrival in the charming city of Hanoi, you will be greeted warmly by our tour guide before proceeding to your reserved hotel.
Hotels in Hanoi begin offering check-in services at 2 p.m., so you can arrive by then or pay an extra price for early check-in.
You will have the rest of the day to unwind after such a lengthy flight to Hanoi.
You can either sleep at that time to refresh your head or wander around the neighborhood around your hotel to take in the ambiance of Hanoi (highly recommended in Hanoi Autumn).

itinerary.title: Day 2: Hanoi City Tour
content: 1. Café Trứng (Egg Coffee) at Café Giảng on Yen Phu St..
2. Long Bien Bridge/ Chuong Duong Bridge
3. Nha Hat Lon (Hanoi Opera House)
4. Ho Guom (Hoàn Kiếm Lake)

itinerary.title: Day 3: Hanoi to Halong Bay - Overnight on Cruise
content: After breakfast, be picked up from your accommodation in Hanoi and driven to the World Heritage site.

When you get there, you'll be welcomed on board, sign in, and enjoy the overnight trip to Halong Bay. Admire the bay's breathtaking beauty, which is enhanced by its countless karst islands, caves, and beaches.
You will engage in activities like sightseeing, kayaking, or swimming following a break for lunch.
You'll be treated to a lavish dinner and the laid-back atmosphere of Halong Bay at night. Enjoy your meal and the rest of your night at sea.

itinerary.title: Day 4: Ha Long Bay and Hanoi Foodie Tour
content: Starting your second day in Halong with a morning Tai-chi class can help you clear your head. The ship will take you to the most breathtaking caverns in Halong for one final expPoppinstion after breakfast.
You will have free time to explore The Old Quarter and sample Vietnamese street food after your flight to Hanoi.

We'll show you how actual Hanoians actually live, work, and eat by taking you into the narrow lanes and alleys of the Old Quarter of Hanoi. This tour, which is by far the most popular of ours, is a lot of fun and a terrific opportunity to learn about some of the lesser-known foods that the locals like eating.

Our four courses will be properly rounded out by Bun Bo (Sauteed Beef Rice Vermicelli), Banh Cuon (Steamed Rice Rolls), 'Banh Mi', and distinctive Ca Phe Trung (Egg Coffee). Experiencing local food and drinks as well as local life and stories. Your travel experience will be much improved by the simple things!

itinerary.title: Day 5: Take a flight to Hue
content: Have breakfast at the hotel, then unwind until takeoff. You will be picked up by our driver and transported to the airport in time for your flight from Hanoi to Hue.
The tour guide meets you at the airport upon arrival and drives you to a hotel in City Centre where you may check in.

A cyclo driver will pick you up from your accommodation in the late afternoon. You'll get the chance to sample a variety of delectable Hue dishes and experience Hue's romanticism at night. Enjoy 'royal foods', which were previously only served to the King, while dining in regal grandeur.

itinerary.title: Day 6: Hue City tour
content: Thien Mu Pagoda is in Hue and is ready for your visit. A well-known Buddhist site, the pagoda is situated on the bank of the Perfume River. Thien Mu Pagoda is ideal for refreshing your thoughts because of its fascinating old design and great position where you may take in the tranquility of the Perfume River.
We continue our adventure after leaving the pagoda by going to the Imperial Citadel. Visit the King's Palace, Flag Tower, Main Gate, and the Museums of Royal Antiquities here.
You can learn about local vendors' daily operations and business practices while browsing kiosks and picking up some unique goods to take home before eating lunch at a nearby restaurant.

After a short break, we visit the Khai Dinh Tomb, which was constructed between 1920 and 1931 and is the smallest of the Nguyen Emperors' tombs but required the longest and most money to construct. This is the ideal fusion of Eastern and Western design.

The next stop on our journey is the most imposing Tomb of Emperor Minh Mang, which is renowned for its scenery and Oriental architecture. Minh Mang planned and began construction on this mausoleum, but King Thieu Tri finished it during the first days of 1841 and 1843. After visiting the Minh Mang Tomb, we'll go to a village where conical hats are made, where we may observe the artisans at work and talk to the residents before returning to the hotel.

itinerary.title: Day 7: Hue - Danang - Hoi An - Road transfer
content: Receive transportation to your Hoi An hotel reservation via private car, shuttle bus, or taxi. You can pause at various locations along the way for sightseeing and photo opportunities (admission fee is not included).
Hanoi has a lot to offer you because of its long history, myriad unique characteristics, and rich culture.

itinerary.title: Day 8: Hoi An like local in Tra Que Village
content: Meet your local guide in the hotel lobby and ride to a farm in Tra Que Village first thing in the morning.

You'll visit the vegetable garden and assist the farmers with several gardening tasks, like raking the ground, seeding, watering greens, collecting greens, and enriching the soil with seaweed from the nearby lake.
Work on the farm for the remainder of the morning, taking a break to prepare lunch with your hosts.
Many regional specialties are served at lunch, such as spring rolls and regional pancakes.
After enjoying a foot massage, bid your host family by and ride back to Hoi An.

You can take a journey to the craftsman's house in the late afternoon, where he will give you a quick introduction to the history, design, and color of lanterns as well as the processes involved in manufacturing them. You will have the opportunity to create your own lantern that you can keep as a keepsake.

itinerary.title: Day 9: Hoi An Foodie Tour
content: The cuisine and culture of Hoi An may be explored in the ideal way on the Evening Foodie trip. Our tour begins just before twilight and takes you to a variety of local cafes, markets, restaurants, and food stalls, providing you with a memorable and full culinary experience.
We begin visiting local locations and perusing the food stands to learn about the local specialties of Hoi An, which include:

note: PROGRAMS & SCHEDULES SUBJECT TO CHANGE WITHOUT PRIOR NOTIC
